name: Freemans
address: Freeman Alley, New York, NY 10002, USA

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stopped here to grab a quick breakfast and the food was unbelievably amazing! I got the sourdough pancakes and they were some of the best pancakes Iâ€™ve ever had. He got a burger and it was amazing and so fresh! We also got lattes and the taste was so rich, they also decorated the top with hearts. Our bartender was amazing and was very attentive and gave us quick service, even though we were to-go orders he still attended to us as if we were eating at the restaurant. The artwork in the alley as you walk up to the restaraunt is amazing as well! We definitely plan to sit down and eat when we have more time!
Great staff. Only do king it because we made reservations a week ahead of time and they sat us at a table right in front of the door that made it difficult to talk and hear.
the best sticky toffee pudding
Had brunch here at the bar today. Everyone who worked here was so lovely. Delicious pancakes and an even better Bellini

Freeman has such an amazing vibe! The place looks beautiful and has a really cool, cozy atmosphere. The staff were super nice and the service was great. The food was okay â€” not bad, just nothing special, definitely worth checking out for the overall experience.

I hosted a private dinner for 12 women in the â€˜blue roomâ€™ at this restaurant and our experience was INCREDIBLE. The space was so quirky yet elegant, the food was out of this freaking world (get the panzenella!!!), and the cherry on the top was the Michelin-level service. Truly, our waiter constantly was looking to help us elevate the night and create an incredible experienceâ€”no request was too small. I could not recommend enough how much you will love hosting an event here, or even just coming here for a normal meal!!

One of my favorite restaurants I have ever been to. I went for my 30th birthday dinner and the vibes were immaculate. It was so cozy and homey; it felt like you were visiting a European pub or hunting lodge. Itâ€™s a hidden gem tucked away in an urban art alley. I had the roasted duck and it was superb. I loved the interior design and seating of the place; it was so unique and eclectic and brilliant. Highly recommend.
Incredible atmosphere w dim lights and a beautiful back bar. The back is the best.  Ben out the speakeasy above. The food at Freemans is solid but I go here mainly for ambiance.

One of my all-time favorite places that I keep coming back to. And last weekend they came thru in a pinch when our book club needed a place last minute for 8 people! The food is great, the atmosphere is fun without being "too much," and the staff are friendly and accommodating.

Kam mir meinen Eltern her zu unserem letzten gemeinsamen Abend vor ihrer Abreise. Der Laden wurde uns mehrfach empfohlen - leider wÃ¼rden wir enttÃ¤uscht.
Essen war gemessen am Preis leider echt enttÃ¤uschend (wir hatten zu dritt das Steak und haben $260 bezahlt): Steak war zÃ¤h, Pfeffersauce unertrÃ¤glich salzig. Nur die broccolini waren sehr gut. Wirklich wohlgefÃ¼hlt haben wir uns ebenfalls nicht, die Bedienung war nicht sonderlich freundlich - insbesondere gemessen an amerikanischen Standards.
Leider nicht empfehlenswert.
cozy and delicious brunch! we had great service with kylie!

Un restaurante Ãºnico!!!
El lugar es genial, desde antes de entrar ya es una experiencia.
El ingreso es por un callejÃ³n en medio de una calle. Pero no cualquier callejÃ³n... es el callejÃ³n de arte Urbano, lleno de imÃ¡genes grÃ¡ficas, estencil, graffitis y personas... al final se ve la entrada al restaurante y resalta por lo linda y limpia que se ve.
El servicio especial, grandes personas, llegamos en el mo.e to del cambio de horario y debiamos esperar a q volvieran a abrir la cocina,  pero aun asi nos entregaron bebidas y antes de la hora de abrir la cocina para las cenas, nos to.aron el pedido... y en el menÃº encuentran el Dip de Alcachofas quÃ© si o si lo deben pedir.
Otro plato fenomenal es la carne y papas fritas quÃ© estÃ¡ deliciosa y ademÃ¡s viene acompaÃ±ada de una salsa exquisita.
Tiene una zona de bar muy bacan y en realidad el espacio es muy bien diseÃ±a do con taxonomÃ­a de animales como una de sus decoraciones principales.
10/10.
VolverÃ© en cada visita a NYC

My husband and I just had our post City Hall wedding dinner here at Freemans. We rented out the Blue Room for 14 people and it was perfect. Communication with their manager Lina leading up was great and booking everything from start to finish was seamless and easy. All of the staff was warm and welcoming and treated us all so kindly. The food was 10/10 and the vibes are cozy and cool. We can not wait to come back and just have a meal ourselves but I highly recommend for special events as well!

After the creative chaos of the alley when you walk in the door at Freeman's. It's a quick vibe shift, quiet, candles, nice atmosphere. The catavelli was so good: flavors and textures, deliciousness. Husband loved the steak too.
Cool decor and vibe. Food was awesome too. Great for brunch or a differentiated dinner/drinks spot.
Fabulous ambiance, good and service. Bartenders are top notch.

When it comes to wedding receptions, generally those with allergies are left in a lynch. People with confused expressions and gestures of good luck. But not here! This place has servers that actually care. With each course that came out, they made sure we got food that wasn't going to torture our insides. The amazing news doesn't stop there though. While you might not like this place if you're with Peta (or at least the decor) you'll find that everything inside is very homey. You'll forget you're in a restaurant. The adventure begins the moment you turn down the alley and walk among the various works of art that surround you. Come with an empty stomach and a sense of wonder.
Trout was awesome. Service was also great.
Terrific find hidden down a much photographed graffiti alley...service spectacular...food scrumptious...atmosphere old timey n comfortable...we will be loyal customers!

Super friendly service and great food. And even the coffee was amazing. It is a place tucked in freeman Alley, that gives the vibe of an old English house. Old decor (including stuffed animals on the walls which some of plus found disturbing). The Norwegian Benedict was great.

Restaurant raffinÃ©, Ã  l'ambiance et au cadre trÃ¨s agrÃ©ables.
Les plats sont Ã©laborÃ©s, certaines recettes sont originales, et les produits sont tous de qualitÃ©.
Une trÃ¨s bonne adresse donc, bien cachÃ©e au fond de son allÃ©e, pour passer un trÃ¨s agrÃ©able moment.
Thank you for getting us in without a reservation, loved the place! We will be back on our next trip. The cocktails were spectacular!
Gluten free
Vibes were there wine was great food was ok

BLACKBIRD APP IS A SCAM
100$ hold for each bill you pay for, on top of the actual amount it comes up to for the food you ordered.â€¦
Cool vibes to go with the great food. Had the oysters and wonderful bottle of wine. Will be returning when visiting New York.

I had a good fortune of having the entire Freeman staff on my team when I proposed to my fiancÃ© on the anniversary of our first date. Jim was the perfect wingman, and the staff and management honored my request to change the soundtrack to something more soft romantic, and it made a massive difference in the experience.
Staff personal are very friendly and professional.... Stop by and share your experience and share your thoughts!!
Good drinks, good vibes, cool location!

Great food and highly recommend sitting upstairs for a more cabin-like feel.  The service was a little slow, but they only had one bartender (who was doing great!) and we noticed another table of three who sat next to us 10 minutes after us got their food first but I think they ordered right before us.

My friends enjoyed their coffee and I liked my cocktail. The food is definitely big portions. Highly recommend sharing the artichoke dip with at least two other people. Will come again!
Great little place, hidden away but well worth tracking down. Great place for a new york brunch.

Freemans Ã¨ un locale carino e particolare, situato in una posizione un po' nascosta. Ci siamo stati di domenica e abbiamo provato il menu del brunch. Questo menu propone alcune aggiunte rispetto a quello normale, rimuovendone perÃ² diverse. Il cibo si Ã¨ rivelato veramente molto buono e anche il prezzo ci Ã¨ sembrato giusto per la qualitÃ  e la quantitÃ  delle portate.

This is the BEST restaurant in Provincetown and I will die on this hill. The chefs use only the freshest and best ingredients that are artfully combined to make the most delicious meal you can get in the state of Massachusetts. The service is incredible. Christopher was incredibly kind, hospitable and knowledgeable about the menu. I canâ€™t say enough about this place. It truly shines among the gems of restaurants in Provincetown.
Outstanding across the charcuterie board

ğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸ
If you want to learn something new or enhance your skills, this app is perfect. The courses are high-quality, instructors are experienced, and the content is up-to-date.
In my opinion, this app is a must-have for every learner.

Finally, a place that serves authentic halal cuisine with a luxurious twist. The interior is classy and the service is five-star!"
â€“ Omar S., New Jersey
This was a really incredible find, who knew that chicken could taste so good? Amish chicken doesnâ€™t sound exciting but it was delish we loved every bite. Great drinks too
English breakfast, I still think about you sometimes.
Great spot for brunch or lunch with friends. Service was friendly and the portions really generous. The chicken club was delicious! Too good I didnâ€™t even get a photo.

Get the 40oz steak at MP. Get a couple of different cocktails  for the evening. Live your life! You only get one, i think. Share this beautiful meat and drink with your friends because it is perfect. It is very accommodating considering I'm extremely anxious. They sat us by the window, and it was perfect. Really calmed me down. As the juggalos would say, WOOOP WOOOOP! Go experience this gem of a place.
Really rude bartending staff- completely ignored us. We tried to get drinks but instead of telling us it was too late, they ignored us entirely.
We had a lovely dinner at the Blue Room. The food and wine were divine. The room could use some tapestries on the walls to lower the noise level, but otherwise perfect!

What a delightful little find wandering through the alley.  Quaint and just auspicious enough to demand reservations, but i lucked out with a seat at the bar and the most amazing trout Iâ€™ve eaten in years.  I ate all the skin too - the bartender probably thought I was weird but there was nothing left on my plate expect the skeleton head and spine.  I would have licked the plate if I could.  Fabulous.  Iâ€™d eat here again and bring friends.
Very cool location. Well decorated spot. Food was fresh and good and the service was attentive and fast. Big portions!

**We found many allergy friendly places in New York. THIS IS NOT ONE OF THEM.**

Visited Freeman's on our anniversary with my girlfriend during our recent trip to New York (May 2025). As a severe allergy sufferer (I carry two epi-pens), we always make it very clear to restaurants that I suffer from multiple allergies and list them out beforehand. We notified the restaurant that it was our anniversary and that I am allergic to Nuts, Sesame Seeds, Shellfish and Beans.

When we arrived, the first thing I mentioned to the waitress serving us was my allergies. I am always very explicit that they are very severe. The waitress noted down each of the allergies and reassured me that she would notify the kitchen. I made my point about 3 times, as I would with anyone serving me, to ensure they understood the importance.

I ordered a Chicken Caesar Salad to start and a Steak as my main.

The Chicken Caesar Salad arrived and before I tucked in, I gave it a quick glance to ensure there was nothing in there I could not eat. I always do this, just to be on the safe side. Although the restaurant is extremely dimly lit, I noticed that there were Sesame Seeds in the salad. First of all this was one of the allergens which I very clearly mentioned to the waitress would cause me to go into a reaction. Secondly, this was not even an ingredient listed in the Caesar Salad on the menu. I was shocked that this had happened and my girlfriend was so stressed she could barely eat. I called over the waitress and sternly explained the situation. The waitress went into defence mode and instantly shifted the blame onto the kitchen, mentioning it was nothing to do with her and that it was the chefs fault. She almost seemed so worried that I was going to sue her that she threw the kitchen under the bus to save herself. She mentioned that she had never seen anything like this before and took my plate away, mentioning that the 'Chef himself' would make me a new one. She also offered me the starter on the house.

I made it abundantly clear and again was very stern that I did not want to leave the restaurant in an ambulance, nor did I want to spend my anniversary evening in an American hospital.

My girlfriend wanted to leave at that point, I should have listened. Instead, I trusted the waitress to bring a new Caesar salad which the 'Chef himself' had made.

As the waitress gave me the fresh Caesar Salad, she mentioned that the kitchen had 'triple checked' for my allergens. I once again inspected the dish. There were sesame seeds AGAIN. I could not believe it. I was so shocked. I told my girlfriend we were leaving and we got up. But not before we called over the waitress and spoke to the manager (who did not seem like she cared very much). The waitress was visibily upset, as were we. This was the most dangerous and unprofessional dining experience I had ever gone through.

Had I not checked the dish (twice) I could have gone into anaphylactic shock.

The waitress offered me the steak to take away but how on earth could I trust them after what I had just seen and experienced.

This was the first time I had ever stormed out of a restaurant.

The fact that the waitress reassured me both the first and then the second times made us feel sick to the pits of our stomachs. In the end this is a matter of safety. If you can not cater to allergies, do not masquerade as if you can. If you have an allergy please DO NOT VISIT THIS RESTAURANT.

This was supposedly the pinnacle of our trip, our anniversary celebration. Instead, we left before our starters - angry, shocked and naseous at what we had just experienced. My girlfriend was in tears and I was also shaking as I had come very close to being hospitalised.

If you have an allergy please stay away from Freeman's, it is simply not safe.
Staff was sub par , food was extremely underwhelming and unseasoned. Very sad we fell for this tourist trap , spend $200 elsewhere!
Very great place mussels were amazing.
Very cool place with a speak easy upstairs.  Definitely worth the trip. Great cocktails.
We had an amazing anniversary dinner here! Christopher was an amazing server and the food was delicious. We will be back our next trip!

Remember visiting this place sometime ago due to recommendation I received then, and honestly I just wasnâ€™t able to be comfortably around those animal heads wall decor. Something very personal but just canâ€™t deal with it, so it was struggling experience.

ì§€ê·¹íˆ ê°œì¸ì ì¸ ë¬¸ì œì¸ë°, ë²½ì— ë™ë¬¼ ë¨¸ë¦¬ í˜•ìƒì˜ ì¥ì‹ì„ ì €ë ‡ê²Œ ì£¼ë ì£¼ë  ë§¤ë‹¬ì•„ë†“ì€ ê·¸ ë¶„ìœ„ê¸°ì— ë„ë¬´ì§€ ì ì‘ì„ í•  ìˆ˜ê°€ ì—†ì–´ì„œ ì „í˜€ ì¦ê²ì§€ ì•Šì•˜ì—ˆë˜ ê¸°ì–µì´ ë‚©ë‹ˆë‹¤.

really awesome space hidden in the end of an active and free nyc museum, just absolutely beautiful decor inside thatâ€™s very warm and inviting. the food is really good and the staff are super attentive. great space for parties with plenty of space and options to enjoy a night with friends

Food was delicious; the sourdough pancakes with the bourbon maple syrup is an absolute must. The French toast is also very delicous; very thick on the challah bread. Price is what you would expect for a NYC brunch.

I absolutely loved the atmosphere at this place which feels like a rustic hunting lodge. The food leans new American and everything I had was pretty tasty. The star for me went to the grilled octopus appetizer with Manila clams that was perfectly cooked and so flavorful. Next up was the pork chop which is a massive cut. Perhaps just a tad overdone for me but still very good and the collard greens that came with it were amazing. If thereâ€™s one course I could have skipped it was dessert. I had the sticky toffee pudding and while it was decent, it wasnâ€™t amazing. Overall it was a really good meal though and I look forward to trying again for their brunch sometime.

Stepping into Freemans is stepping into colonial New York. You are instantly transported to a time of rugged simple elegance. The dark paneled walls and plank floors with early American oils hangs by throughout showing off their idyllic beauty from the glass paned windows and candlelit crevices.
The food was absolutely exceptional! Watermelon Feta Salad was so refreshing and the Sticky Toffee Pudding is not to be passed up. We even received two glasses of bubbly to commemorate our birthday celebration.
Main courses and f Cavatelli and Steak Frites hit the mark and of course the side of Macaroni and cheese was winning combination.
The Cocktails Orpheus Ascending by and Mayan Harvest were outstanding!
The service from Brittany was superb. Dinner was well paced and her anticipatory attention was appreciated and noticed but unobtrusive and meld with the harmony of the rhythm of the courses served. I certainly canâ€™t wait to be back for this transportive experience. All that was missing was Alexander Hamilton sauntering in. Bravo!

I love the interior layout of the restaurant! Great vibes. The food is decent, but it is at the pricy end for brunch. I had the English Breakfast. There was nothing special about it just normal breakfast that you might make yourself honestly, but it is a great place to meet up with your friends and family for a brunch once in a while just for the environment and atmosphere. I definitely wonâ€™t recommend ordering coffee tho.

As you approach Freemans, you might feel a twinge of curiosity due to the funky vibe of the alleyway leading to the entrance. However, stepping inside, you'll soon discover that the restaurant exudes a unique charm and an adventurous spirit that sets the tone for a memorable dining experience.

The brunch menu is nothing short of remarkable, featuring an enticing array of sweet and savory dishes that cater to a variety of tastes and preferences. Among the selections, my personal favorites stand out: the acai chia pudding, a beautifully presented bowl filled with creamy, nutrient-packed goodness, and the breakfast potatoes, perfectly seasoned and crispy, adding just the right crunch to the meal.

What truly elevated our visit was the exceptional service we received. The hostess, radiating warmth and friendliness, went above and beyond to make our experience memorable, even surprising us with celebratory drinks in honor of my birthday. This thoughtful gesture added a delightful touch to our outing, making it unforgettable. All in all, Freemans is a fantastic place that beautifully blends delicious food with top-notch hospitality.

We came to Freemans for brunch on a Sunday in a group of 4. We had reservations and were 15 minutes late but had no issues being seated. The vibe here is really nice - kinda homey and rustic. It was a pleasant experience. On the recommendations of other reviews, we had the Hot Artichoke Dip as a starter and it was great, so I would also suggest ordering that. The Norwegian Benedict was pretty decent but kind of basic. I would probably order something else next time. The Sourdough Pancakes were delicious, especially with the salted walnut butter. We were able to substitute the bourbon maple syrup for regular maple syrup. The service here was very good, the bathrooms were clean, and there was a guy who looks like Ben Affleck having brunch.
This place is magical! I canâ€™t believe itâ€™s in manhattan! It looks like a lodge in Aspen or something. The food and the service are both amazing! I heard they have insanely good cocktails too!

Interesting place to have food.  The place has a wonderful vibrant atmosphere.  The inside and environment is unique.  The place will cram you in and will seat guests in the most awkward placement.  The food needed a little help.  My fullâ€¦

This place is an incredible American restaurant! ğŸ´ Freemans at the end of the Freemans Alley offers an amazing ğŸ¤© selection of delicious ğŸ¤¤ dishes! ğŸ½ï¸ Definitely get the Steak ğŸ¥© and Pesto Pasta! ğŸ The place is beautifully decorated ğŸ›‹ï¸, the ambience ğŸ¶ is great, staff ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ³ is friendly and professional, and the service is quick. â²ï¸ I wish I came here sooner and more often!

Love this charming spot for excellent food and drinks at the end of a graffiti filled alley. Worked with them on a private dinner for 18 and had a great experience from beginning to end, and guests were very happy with the meal, service, cocktails and wine. Great communication from Lina and the team throughout the process. We also attended a private event there a few months ago--they definitely know what they are doing when it comes to private events and dinner parties.

Food was on point each dish lots flavor well done. Service very nice. Only things place little small and table to close. But that nothing bad just my preference have little more space.  Overall well done thank you

Down a graffiti art covered alley, Freeman's offers a rustic and cozy vibe. We are there for brunch and had a great visit. Their coffee is fantastic. I had the British breakfast plate, veggie styled. Everything was good and I would visit again.

What a fun tucked away spot! I love the alley entrance leading up to the doors. Cute interior and ambiance. Went for brunch with a group of 10 and it was lovely. Pricey but the food is good and our servers were really sweet. Get the artichoke dip. Awesome Bloody Mary too. Chicken and waffles was interesting - kind-of smoky flavor which was a fun twist on the usual. Oh, and bottomless coffee!

My experience at Freemans was delightful, featuring delicious food and excellent service. While I appreciated the rustic ambiance, I don't care for the use of animals as decoration, though it didn't detract from the overall pleasant atmosphere.

We had an avocado-toast, five-cheese mac and cheese, and a Bloody Mary. The avocado toast was a standout, and I would gladly order it again and recommend it.
However, the true stars were the mac and cheese and the Bloody Mary. The mac and cheese had the perfect balance of creaminess and cheese flavor, while the Bloody Mary was expertly crafted and to my taste spicy but not overwhelming, with just the right amount of tomato. Overall, a memorable dining experience that I would happily repeat.

Very unique area with in an alley. The graffiti gives it a nice touch when walking in. Once you make it to the end is where it's located.

We were wondering if we needed reservations. Went in around 1:30pm on a Sunday, not much of a wait as we sat at the bar til the table outside was ready. Service was quick and the waiter made many good suggestions and was awesome. The food and drinks were amazing, i would definitely come back for brunch in the future at this location.

I made a reservation to dine here for restaurant week. I sat at the bar, which was cozy but tight. I appreciated the prompt of service by the bartender and accuracy of making multiple drinks. The dishes were delicious, but the mussels appetizer was first place for me. Here are a few pictures to show why these food options are worth ordering.

Loved this ğŸ’ at the end of an alley, named Freeman's Alley.  I loved the vibe at Freeman.  You can imagine having a drink with George Washington or any of our Founding Fathers.  It has the feel of a Colonial Tavern.  I went for Weekday Brunch so it wasn't crowded.  The Artichoke Spinach Dip is amazing.  I had The Crow as my cocktail.  It was ğŸ˜‹.  It's basis is Scotch and Irish Whiskey and it has Amontillado, Coconut, Ginger and Carrot.  It's creamy and rich and packs a punch.  The bartender, Beatriz, was a wonderful bartender.  The service is good.  The prices are a little high but on par for the area.  I will definitely be back.

Hidden restaurant in Lover East Side. That restaurant is so different from anything you know or you been in. Itâ€™s two story place both floors have bar and rooms for pastries. Second floor has lounge with comfy couches. Big choice of red , white and sparkling wine. My Artichoke dip was good and portion was a good size . Pork chop was huge itâ€™s good for two people. Desert was not that good and I would like for ice cream to be just a little bigger. I definitely have to comeback to try more dishes.

This restaurant used to be a hidden, kind of a secret spot that wasnâ€™t really known to many people. The words have gotten out since then, and it is now a super popular spot.

We didnâ€™t have a reservation, so we decided to get there early. We didnâ€™t have any issue getting a table with just a handful of people at that time. The inside was very cozy. Feeling of an old tavern or a log cabin, filled with animals and antlers on the walls.

They had brunch menu and lunch menu, and you can order from both menu during brunch. We ordered Five Cheese Macaroni and Skillet Eggs.  They both came in a small iron skillet. It was smaller than expected, but I always say quality over quantity. They were packed with flavor, comforting, and made really well.

We had a nice, relaxing, tasty brunch here. The service was polite and nice, we were well taken care of. The menu is a bit on pricey side, but the quality is super high. I have been wanting to try Freemans for quite a long time, I am glad we finally got to dine here! I would like to go back for more, and try some of their cocktails as well in a near future!

Great delicious tasting food, but this place gets 3.5 stars for me due to lack of service and overall experience being subpar at best.

We ordered the steak, pork shop, deviled horseback (bacon wrapped dish) and the banana foster for dessert. We shared all the dishes between 3 people and were quite full!

The acoustics and noise level in the restaurant made it a bit challenging to hear the person across from me, and the seating arrangement we had was right beside the bar so people kept bumping into my chair and made the experience a bit unpleasant.

Overall, the meal was delightful (and Iâ€™d probably give the food 4.5 stars), but dining in is an experience and the lack of it brought this rating down to 3.

Nice restaurant gives the look of being very old although we were kind of doped I fell as it is only 20 years old lol Anyways besides that the food we 3.5/5, service was great and atmosphere was generally very nice. The locality is unique which drew us there (the graffitis outside are amazing sight). We tried fish, steak, pork chops, and pasta with Brussels sprouts and salad so basically all varieties of food you can say. Felt prices are quite high for the quality and taste. Also nothing comes with side except steak which is also very odd considering the prices of entrees. Donâ€™t think we will go back but decent for a one night dinner spot without reservations. We spent about $275 for four no drinks or desserts.
